page.title: 19A Brief History of Kirkby
page.content: The block is located to the north of the Metropolitan Borough of Knowsley embracing much of the township of Kirkby. Kirkby, meaning church and settlement, was a village established by Vikings in 900 A.D. Entered in the Domesday Book as Cherchebi, one of the manors held by Uctred the thegn, it was mainly woodland incorporating the parish of Simonswood. A notable landmark is the church of St. Chad who, it is believed, visited Kirkby during the latter half of the 7th century. The church is a particularly fine example of Norman architecture. On its saddleback central tower is a large cross which is illuminated at night and can be seen for miles around.
